tests

Class JUnit_UnboundedStorageSpecification

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.JUnit_UnboundedStorageSpecification
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JUnit_Queue2Stack_ReliableStack, JUnit_Queue2Stack_UnreliableStack, JUnit_QueueShareStack_ReliableStack, JUnit_QueueShareStack_UnreliableStack, JUnit_ReliableStack, JUnit_UnreliableStack

    public abstract class JUnit_UnboundedStorageSpecification
extends java.lang.Object
    Unit tests for checking bounded storage behaviour as specified by UnboundedStorageSpecification
    Author:
    J Paul Gibson
    updated by @author btdiem
    change test_is_empty()
    remove test_is_full()
    remove test_push_NOK()
    remove test_toString()
    rename test_performance() to test_performance1()
    add test_performance2()
    add test_performance3()
    add test_performance4()

      (package private) UnboundedStorageSpecification<java.lang.Integer> storage
      The bounded storage under test

      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void setUp()
      This method needs to construct a concrete instance of a bounded storage to be tested.
      void tearDown() 
      void test_get_size() 
      void test_head() 
      void test_headKO() 
      void test_is_empty() 
      void test_performance1()
      Make a million calls to each of the bounded storage methods and check that the delay is no bigger than a second
      void test_performance2()
      Push 1000000 elements once and then call head() and pop() until storage is empty
      Check that the delay is no bigger than a second
      void test_performance3()
      Push() and head() 1000000 elements into storage respectively
      Then call pop() this storage until it is empty Check that the delay is no bigger than a second
      void test_performance4()
      push() and head() , pop(), is_empty() and get_size() 1000000 elements are called randomly
      Check that the delay is no bigger than 300 milliseconds
      void test_pop() 
      void test_popKO() 
      void test_push()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public abstract void setUp()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method needs to construct a concrete instance of a bounded storage to be tested. This should be an empty storage with the maximum bound set to be 3.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test_performance1

        public void test_performance1()
        Make a million calls to each of the bounded storage methods and check that the delay is no bigger than a second

      • test_performance2

        public void test_performance2()
        Push 1000000 elements once and then call head() and pop() until storage is empty
        Check that the delay is no bigger than a second

      • test_performance3

        public void test_performance3()
        Push() and head() 1000000 elements into storage respectively
        Then call pop() this storage until it is empty Check that the delay is no bigger than a second

      • test_performance4

        public void test_performance4()
        push() and head() , pop(), is_empty() and get_size() 1000000 elements are called randomly
        Check that the delay is no bigger than 300 milliseconds
